id_table_1.caption: Online survey questions for study Part 1.
id_table_1.table:
Label Questions Scale Label (cf. Table II)
Demographic Questions
Q1 Rate your knowledge of formal methods Ordinal LS1
Q2 How many years have you used formal methods in your daily work? (answer the duration separately for academia and industry) Ordinal LS2
Q3 List the application(s) you worked on using formal methods (if available) Nominal Not Applicable
Q4 How many years have you worked in the safety domain? (only in industries) Ordinal LS2
Q5 List the application(s) you worked on focusing on safety aspects (if available) Nominal Not Applicable
Main Survey Questions
Q6 How easy it is for you to identify inconsistent specifications? Nominal and Ordinal LS3
Q7 What sort of methods do you use to identify inconsistent specifications? Nominal Not Applicable
Q8 How fast could you identify inconsistent specifications? Nominal and Ordinal LS4
Q9 What are the challenges that you face in order to identify inconsistent specifications? Nominal Not Applicable
Q10 How easy is it for you to maintain consistency when refining requirements for sub-components? Nominal and Ordinal LS3
Q11 In your opinion, how beneficial is the identification of inconsistent specifications for a safety analysis? Nominal and Ordinal LS5
Q12 How hard is it for you to check the consistency of requirements that are associated with components? Nominal and Ordinal LS3
Q13 How easy is it for you to understand formal notations? Nominal and Ordinal LS3
Q14 What is your opinion on using formal verification? Nominal Not Applicable
Q15 In your opinion, will the usage of formal verification make systems safer? Nominal and Ordinal LS5
Q16 In your opinion, can the formal verification be an add-on to the functional safety methods to ensure safety? Nominal and Ordinal LS5
Q17 Can you imagine using formal methods if their understanding of formal notations is made easier? Nominal and Ordinal LS5
Q18 Do you think formal methods are usable in real-world development processes? Nominal and Ordinal LS5

id_table_2.caption: Likert and answer scales used for this study.
id_table_2.table:
Label Type Likert & Answer Scales
LS1 Expertise Novice, Advanced Beginner, Competent, Proficient, Expert, Mastery, Practical Wisdom, No Opinion
LS2 Experience >=>= 1, << 1 to 2, << 2 to 4, << 4 to 6, << 6 to 8, << 8 to 10, << 10, No Experience
LS3 Agreement Extremely Hard, Hard, Slightly Hard, Neither Hard nor Easy, Slightly Easy, Easy, Extremely Easy, No Opinion
LS4 Agreement Extremely Fast, Fast, Slightly Fast, Neither Fast nor Slow, Slightly Slow, Slow, Extremely Slow, No Opinion
LS5 Likelihood Definitely, Very Probably, Probably, Neither Probably or Possibly, Possibly, Probably Not, Definitely Not, No Opinion
LS6 Agreement Strongly agree, Agree, Somewhat agree, Neither agree or disagree, Somewhat disagree, Disagree, Strongly disagree, No Opinion
LS7 Usefulness Exceptional, Excellent, Very Good, Good, Fair, Poor, Very Poor, No Opinion

id_table_3.caption: : One-group pretest and posttest questions.
id_table_3.table:
Label Questions Scale Label (cf. Table II)
Task Questions
TQ1 How difficult was this use case for you to understand? Nominal and Ordinal LS5
TQ2 Do you think this use case is difficult? Nominal and Ordinal LS5
TQ3 Do you think you have understood results from the model checker? (This question is only for pretest) Nominal and Ordinal LS5
TQ4 Do you think you have understood the explanations? (This question is only for the posttest) Nominal and Ordinal LS5
TQ5 Of the following list, please select the inconsistent components. Nominal Not Applicable
TQ6 Of the following list, please select the inconsistent specifications. Nominal Not Applicable
TQ7 Please explain the reason that makes the specifications inconsistent from your understanding. Nominal Not Applicable
TQ8 Please provide a solution to fix the inconsistency from your understanding. Nominal Not Applicable
TQ9 Please provide a nominal behavior that is expected in the counterexample’s erroneous states from your understanding. Nominal Not Applicable
Understanding Model Checker Results (Pretest)
PRQ1 The results from the model checker allow me to understand the inconsistencies. Nominal and Ordinal LS6
PRQ2 The results from the model checker make me confident that I really understand the inconsistencies that I am investigating. Nominal and Ordinal LS6
PRQ3 The value added by such a result from the model checker will be minimal. Nominal and Ordinal LS6
PRQ4 Such a result from the model checker could save me time. Nominal and Ordinal LS6
Understanding our Counterexample Explanation Approach Results (Posttest)
POQ1 The value added by an approach like counterexample explanation is minimal. Nominal and Ordinal LS6
POQ2 An approach like counterexample explanation saves me time. Nominal and Ordinal LS6
POQ3 An approach like counterexample explanation allows me to better understand inconsistencies. Nominal and Ordinal LS6
POQ4 An approach like counterexample explanation makes me more confident that I really understand the inconsistencies that I am investigating. Nominal and Ordinal LS6
Counterexample Explanation Features (Ratings)
FQ1 Translation of specifications from formal temporal format to natural language-like format. Nominal and Ordinal LS7
FQ2 Listing inconsistent specification. Nominal and Ordinal LS7
FQ3 Highlighting sub-parts of the inconsistent specifications that leads to an inconsistency. Nominal and Ordinal LS7
FQ4 Providing the component name that belongs to the inconsistent specifications. Nominal and Ordinal LS7
FQ5 Providing an expected nominal behavior in the explanation for the corresponding erroneous states and variables of the counterexample. Nominal and Ordinal LS7
FQ6 Highlighting the erroneous states and variables in the counterexample. Nominal and Ordinal LS7
Feedbacks (After completion of the experiment)
FE1 Are inconsistencies easier to understand with the results created by the counterexample explanation approach in comparison to those of the original model checker? Nominal and Ordinal LS5
FE2 What challenges did you face while analyzing inconsistencies in a specification with the proposed approach? Nominal Not Applicable
FE3 Do you think it is easy to maintain consistency with the proposed counterexample explanation while refining requirements into requirements for sub-components? Nominal and Ordinal LS3
FE4 Do you think the proposed counterexample explanation approach is usable in real-world development processes? Nominal and Ordinal LS5
FE5 Would you consider using formal methods with our approach in real-world projects? Nominal and Ordinal LS5
FE6 Would you consider using the presented approach in your project? If so, please name the project and a contact person? Nominal and Ordinal LS5
FE7 Do you think presenting a list of possible suggestions/fixes would be helpful to understand and fix inconsistencies? Nominal and Ordinal LS5
FE8 Suggestions for further improvements. Nominal Not Applicable
